intro: Erycibe coriacea, commonly known as the rough-skinned nightshade, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters tall, with thick, woody stems covered in a rough, bark-like texture. Its leaves are ovate, dark green, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are yellow or red when ripe, containing several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests and is part of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and peppers.
